meanings.definition: To signal or summon someone with a gesture or nod.
meanings.sent1: She beckons her friend over with a wave.
meanings.sent2: The flickering light beckons weary travelers to safety.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel beckons the cat to play a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The distant sound of laughter beckons memories of childhood.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies beckons customers into the bakery.

meanings.sent1: The colorful display in the shop window beckons passersby to come inside.
meanings.sent2: The promise of adventure beckons the young explorer to set off on a journey.
meanings.sent3: The tempting smell of popcorn beckons moviegoers to the concession stand.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious treasure map beckons brave adventurers to seek its hidden riches.
meanings.sent5: The soothing melody of the music beckons listeners to relax and unwind.

meanings.sent1: He beckons his guests to join him at the festive table.
meanings.sent2: The warm glow of the campfire beckons campers to gather around and share stories.
meanings.sent3: The twinkling stars beckon lovers to dance under the night sky.
meanings.sent4: The gentle breeze beckons children to come out and play in the park.
meanings.sent5: The cheerful laughter of friends beckons others to join in the fun.
